question: A transverse wave traveling along a string has an amplitude of 2 cm and a wavelength of 0.5 m. If the wave travels at a speed of 10 m/s, what is the frequency of the wave?
solution: The frequency of a wave can be found using the formula f = v / λ, where f is the frequency, v is the wave speed, and λ is the wavelength. In this case, v = 10 m/s and λ = 0.5 m. Substituting these values into the formula, we get f = 10 m/s / 0.5 m = 20 Hz. The amplitude of the wave does not affect the frequency.
